author: Sally Grage-Moore
title: The women who changed their lives to become writers
text: As a young woman, Lindy Ralph always loved writing, but got sidetracked. Training as a dental nurse and working across varied jobs in her 20s, including as a stage manager, she found herself pregnant with her son at 30 and became a single mother. The dental nursing put food on the table during this time but, after some years, she realised she was drawn to working in a creative field again. Ralph decided it was time to prioritise her own life again and ‚Äòdo what I really wanted to do‚Äô ‚Äì which was learn how to make money from writing ‚Äì ‚Äòbut I just didn‚Äôt know how,‚Äô she says. First she enrolled in a Bachelor of Creative Arts at La Trobe University in Bendigo, but when she lost her tour business during COVID in 2020, she decided to move back to Melbourne with her partner. At the age of 52, she enrolled in the Associate Degree of Professional Writing and Editing (PWE) at RMIT University. It was during this time that Ralph discovered she liked non-fiction writing and having three stories published on Mamamia and one on ABC Everyday gave her confidence to keep trying. ‚ÄòIt was an exciting time in my life because I was finally studying something I actually enjoyed.‚Äô There are many reasons people may change careers throughout their working lives, but what motivates 50-plus-year-old women to do this is another story. One of determination. Elizabeth Jolley is well-known as one of Australia‚Äôs most famous ‚Äúlate bloomer‚Äù women writers. During the 1991 Elizabeth Jolley lecture at Curtin University, Hazel Hawke acknowledged Jolley as one of Australia‚Äôs best loved and most significant authors. As reported in the Curtin University publication, Voice, Hawke said both she and Jolley had found their individual paths later in life, after raising families and living in their husbands‚Äô shadows. Jolley published her first book at 53 and Hawke published her autobiography at 63. Barb Kelly is a mother of four children, one of whom has autism. Her early life was devoted to her children, being financially secure in a career as a teacher and working in the family businesses, namely a motel and delicatessen. Kelly says, ‚ÄòI was a bit of a family joke as I often wrote poems and speeches at birthdays and celebrations.‚Äô She had done writing courses before, but after retiring from teaching in 2017 she became a student again, also in the Professional Writing and Editing course at RMIT. Now at 69, she says, ‚ÄòI feel like my life has changed forever doing this course.‚Äô Kelly adds, ‚ÄòI think the PWE course provides powerful skills for women if they plan to change careers. There are so many exciting parts of a creative career and the development of circles of support within the students and teachers are forever.‚Äô Ralph agrees, saying she has ‚Äòincredible support from my PWE friends and teachers‚Äô. A career change will often involve heading back to study ‚Äì whether at TAFE or university. Mature aged students are making up a greater and greater proportion of the student population. ‚ÄòThe profile of current students is getting older. In 2022, around 49% of people studying for a non-school qualification were aged 15-24 years. This compares with 52% of all students a decade earlier in 2012, and 54% of all students in 2002.‚Äô Australian Bureau of Statistics (May 2022), [Education and Work, Australia](https://www.abs.gov.au/statistics/people/education/education-and-work-australia/may-2022). Shaina Feinberg writes about women ‚Äòblooming in their own time‚Äô in her 2020, [New York Times](https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/21/business/blooming-in-their-own-time.html) article. She quotes actor turned writer Abby McEnany as saying, ‚ÄòThe term Late Bloomer made it seem like there was a prescribed age where you should have stuff. I don‚Äôt subscribe to that. Why should society get to say you‚Äôre late for something?‚Äô I recently celebrated my 50th birthday in New York, a lifelong dream. Reaching this milestone, and recovering from burnout in my teaching job, prompted my decision to resign and follow my passion to study writing. I too enrolled in PWE at RMIT. I was thrilled to find that I wasn‚Äôt the only woman of my age in my cohort. I have asked some of my fellow classmates, ‚ÄòWhy writing?‚Äô and ‚ÄòWhy now?‚Äô An early love of writing is a repeated theme, and something that had been put on hold to pursue ‚Äúreal jobs‚Äù is a shared experience among these women. A sense of it now being ‚Äútheir turn‚Äù after marrying, raising children or working in careers that were unfulfilling, and having something important to say comes through. An understanding that a long life is not guaranteed, and that life can be pulled out from under you at any time, is also a motivating factor. Kora Fuller comes from a Greek migrant background, with English as a second language. She says, ‚ÄòI had no control over my life for a very long time, even during marriage. It‚Äôs only been in the last five years that I‚Äôve been able to turn this around. A career in writing feels real only now, this year, during this course. I never thought it was ever possible until now. Writing and being around writers makes me feel so good and like my true self.‚Äô Read: [Upcoming books for 2024, January to June](https://www.artshub.com.au/news/news/upcoming-books-for-2024-january-to-june-2688545/) Marika Vertzonis trained as an engineer and works in a job writing technical documentation. She feels this was maybe ‚Äòthe apprenticeship she needed‚Äô for moving into ‚Äòreal writing‚Äô. The love of storytelling in her family and the migration stories told to her by her father, uncles and grandparents have inspired her to want to write these stories as historical fiction, preserving them for the generations to come. ‚ÄòTaking risks and trying something new has always worked well for me,‚Äô says Anne-Marie Turner, who comes to the course from a background in medicine. ‚ÄòWriting has been a way to process events and try to create something beautiful from them. At this stage of our lives, we have so much life experience. That wisdom and perspective, with added talent and craft, can make for a successful writer.‚Äô Barb Kelly is not deluded about the challenges of choosing writing as a career. ‚ÄòI know we have been repeatedly told that there is very little financial success in the writing field, and I can see that it is not very easy to write the ‚Äúbest seller‚Äù. I still think that any learning is of benefit and that different people will seize upon different careers according to their individual ideas.‚Äô In her 2016 ArtsHub article, [Be comforted by 10 late bloomer careers](https://www.artshub.com.au/news/features/be-comforted-by-10-late-bloomer-careers-252096-2353547/), Madeleine Dore wrote, ‚ÄòDespite experiencing more than 39 rejections in one year alone ‚Ä¶ [Elizabeth Jolley] went on to publish 15 novels and four short story collections well into her 70s.‚Äô There is no shortage of women who have led the way in becoming successful writers later in life and inspire us to do the same. It‚Äôs our time now and we‚Äôre determined to make the most of it.

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - India‚Äôs agonising wait for historic first remains amid all-time thrashing by SA
text:
Summary by Ground News South Africa beat India by an innings and 32 runs in Centurion. Virat Kohli top scored for India with 76 but the rest of the batting collapsed. Dean Elgar (185) and Marco Jansen (84 not out) transformed a slender 11-run lead for South Africa at the start of play. Share menu More

text:

CADCHF: Bullish Reversal Potential - Long Trade Setup
[OANDA:CADCHF](/symbols/CADCHF/)CAD/CHF
üìâ Overview:
CADCHF is shifting from a downtrend to sideways movement, signaling a potential bullish reversal. A sharp bullish divergence and a strong 97% bullish market sentiment enhance the likelihood of an upward move.
üìä Technical Analysis:
Transition from downtrend to sideways, coupled with a bullish divergence, sets the stage for a potential bullish reversal.
üìà Market Sentiment:
A robust 97% bullish sentiment supports the potential strength of the upward reversal.
üìâ Trade Strategy:
Traders may consider a long trade if the key level at 0.63910 is breached. Entry points near the coming higher lows (HL) or Fibonacci retracement levels like 0.236 or 0.382 are potential considerations.
üõë Risk Management:
Implementing effective risk management, including appropriate stop-loss orders, is crucial to safeguard capital.
üìà Conclusion:
CADCHF presents a compelling long trade opportunity with bullish signals and strong market sentiment. Monitor the break above 0.63910 and adjust positions based on evolving market conditions.

author: Clarin.com - Home
title: C√≥mo es Rotting Christ, la banda griega perseguida por gobiernos e Iglesia, criticada por Dave Mustaine e inmensamente exitosa
text: Nada menos que ‚ÄúCristo Pudri√©ndose‚Äù es el nombre de la legendaria banda Rotting Christ, precursora del black metal europeo y originaria de Atenas, Grecia. El grupo tiene 35 a√±os de historia y demostrar√° su vigencia este s√°bado 24 de febrero en "From Hell Festival" en Arena Sur, un valiente ciclo de resistencia sonora y adoraci√≥n a los g√©neros m√°s violentos y oscuros del metal, m√∫sica extrema y anti comercial. En las dos fechas inaugurales se presentaron el cantante original de Iron Maiden, Paul DiAnno y las glorias del thrash metal Vio-Lence y Exhorder. Las entradas se consiguen por sistema TicketFlash y los grupos invitados ser√°n Dislepsia, Inazulina y Lepergod. Resistidos, perseguidos y exitosos El grupo de los hermanos Sakis y Themis Tolis irrumpi√≥ en la escena a fuerza de una brutal combinaci√≥n de grindcore (quiz√° el subg√©nero m√°s bestial del metal) y una llamativa voluntad de ‚Äúdramatizar‚Äù esos temas ultra veloces y guturales de la mano de teclados tocados con total rusticidad. Su presencia fue una molestia para algunos sectores del mundillo metalero, a tal punto que alguna vez [Dave Mustaine](https://www.clarin.com/espectaculos/dave-mustaine-ansioso-volver-megadeth-argentina-dice-enchufa-guitarra-siente-poderoso_0_vGxH7vpDjK.html) de Megadeth puso como condici√≥n no tocar en festivales junto a ellos. Los pol√≠ticos de varios pa√≠ses del mundo pusieron la vista en Rotting Christ y su nombre tan provocativo. Fueron criticados por Gary Bauer, el senador ultraconservador estadounidense y colaborador de Trump y Reagan, cuando la banda fue prohibida. Hasta sus miembros cayeron detenidos en 2018 a la llegada a la capital georgiana de Tbilisi, acusados de ser sospechosos de terroristas. En sus comienzos, el intento o b√∫squeda sonora de Rotting Christ no dio resultados inmediatos, pero el √≠mpetu por llevar su sonido al siguiente nivel se hizo notar en cada paso discogr√°fico de la banda, que ya suma trece discos de estudio. Fueron peque√±os pelda√±os que el grupo atraves√≥ para convertirse en una entidad musical respetada en su particular nicho, valorada como referentes del black metal m√°s sofisticado y atmosf√©rico. Habla en cantante y guitarrista En un break de la gira latina, reci√©n aterrizado en Colombia el cantante y guitarrista Sakis Tolis, atiende el llamado de Clar√≠n. Su voz es gruesa, su acento tosco, su actitud es clara: sin ser descort√©s, contesta sin vueltas, en clara actitud y en plan de ‚Äúboludeces, no‚Äù. -Adem√°s del nombre provocador, ¬øpor qu√© cre√©s que fueron el centro de las cr√≠ticas de los gobiernos y tambi√©n de otros m√∫sicos de la escena del metal? -Elegimos ese nombre con la idea de molestar, que fue el prop√≥sito de la m√∫sica black metal a comienzos de los a√±os '90. Si te fij√°s en la mayor√≠a de las bandas de esa √©poca, ver√°s que ten√≠an una muy mala reputaci√≥n en la prensa y en la sociedad en general. En Europa fuimos parte de esa idea de ‚Äúcrear problemas‚Äù. Lo seguimos siendo, aunque cambiamos nosotros y tambi√©n el mundo. Creo que el nombre que tenemos a√∫n es efectivo para dejar en claro que no seguimos las pautas del sistema. -Ustedes declaran que no son sat√°nicos, ¬øpero c√≥mo pueden separar la idea de llamarse ‚ÄúCristo Pudri√©ndose‚Äù y no ser satanistas? -‚ÄúSatanistas‚Äù es una palabra muy grande, no nos consideramos as√≠, sino m√°s bien anti-religi√≥n. Es la esencia de la banda. Creemos que lo contrario a la religi√≥n es lo que hace que la gente avance, de pasos evolutivos. Y no estamos solamente en contra de Cristo, como sugerir√≠a nuestro nombre, sino que estamos en contra de todas las religiones. -Para el gran p√∫blico, Slayer, Kiss y Marilyn Manson eran bandas que se opon√≠an al cristianismo. ¬øSe sienten representados por la forma en que estos artistas despreciaban al establishment religioso? -Algunas de estas bandas nos gustan, Slayer y [Kiss ](https://www.clarin.com/espectaculos/musica/gene-simmons-vez-serio-kiss-despide-diciembre-_0_a1EOyNLw4B.html)por ejemplo, pero nosotros somos otra cosa. Somos parte de la escena black metal europea, algo mucho m√°s underground. No seguimos a estas bandas sat√°nicas al estilo estadounidense. -¬øHay alg√∫n grupo mainstream que te guste por su filosof√≠a opuesta a la religi√≥n? -Me gusta mucho Ghost, una banda que la gente suele decir que son pop-rock. Creo que hacen lo suyo muy bien. La pelea con Mustaine -¬øC√≥mo definir√≠as la evoluci√≥n sonora de la banda, desde los inicios b√°sicos hasta el black metal dram√°tico y atmosf√©rico actual? -‚ÄúEvoluci√≥n‚Äù es la palabra m√°s importante para nosotros. Todo lo que no evoluciona muere, entonces siempre intentamos probar nuevas cosas. Puedo decir que evolucionamos mucho, s√≠, pero tambi√©n somos fieles a nuestras ra√≠ces, en las que siempre nos dedicaremos a hacer verdadero metal oscuro. -El incidente con Dave Mustaine de Megadeth es conocido en todo el mundo. ¬øCrees que la escena del metal es hip√≥crita de alguna manera? -No es que sea una escena hip√≥crita, es que hay gente a la que no le gusta que les digan algunas verdades. Seguramente habr√° algunos hip√≥critas, s√≠. Pero pod√©s estar en desacuerdo y no formar parte de ese grupo de conservadores que siempre ven al black metal del peor modo. -¬øC√≥mo te sent√≠s al ser parte del ciclo de conciertos ‚ÄúFrom Hell‚Äù en un lugar como Buenos Aires? -Genial. Quiero de hecho agradecer a todos los hermanos y hermanas de metal en Argentina, a quienes estoy muy feliz de ver en unos d√≠as. S√© que est√°n enfrentando grandes problemas econ√≥micos y financieros, pero cr√©anme que si se mantienen fieles a su esp√≠ritu todo va a mejorar. ¬°Levantemos todos nuestros dedos del medio y mandemos a la mierda a todos los pol√≠ticos corruptos! Sobre la firma Newsletter Clar√≠n Tags relacionados

author: @WDTV5News
title: First recovery center in Harrison County holds grand opening
text:
First recovery center in Harrison County holds grand opening
QUIET DELL, W.Va. (WDTV) - The first recovering center in Harrison County held its grand opening early Wednesday evening.
Arch Recovery Center in Quiet Dell is an in-patient comprehensive detoxification and rehab facility for drug and alcohol addiction.
Services at the center include individual therapy, group therapy, medical supervision, and aftercare planning.
The center has already had 15 graduates since operations began seven weeks ago.
Executive Director, Lou Ortenzio, said the opening of the facility is a step in the right direction for the area, and that he‚Äôs very pleased with the success the center has already seen in its patients.
‚ÄúWe know we‚Äôre making a difference,‚Äù said Ortenzio. ‚ÄúThe camaraderie with the jobs here, the connectiveness, the bonds that are formed here ‚Äî I mean, the residents who stay here on this ship for 28 days ‚Äî is truly remarkable.‚Äù
Dignitaries including Secretary of State, Kris Warner and State Senator, Ben Queen were present at the grand opening.
Copyright 2025 WDTV. All rights reserved.

author: @xunta
title: O Director de Industrias Culturais subli√±a o papel do festival singular de Nar√≥n na profesionalizaci√≥n do‚Ä¶
text:
Jacobo Sutil participou na presentaci√≥n da 10¬™ edici√≥n do evento, que ter√° lugar do 7 ao 30 de marzo no Pazo da Cultura naron√©s
O Director de Industrias Culturais subli√±a o papel do festival singular de Nar√≥n na profesionalizaci√≥n do mon√≥logo como formato teatral
Anunciou que a Xunta abrir√° nas pr√≥ximas semanas a s√∫a convocatoria anual de axudas a festivais de artes esc√©nicas, a trav√©s da que en 2024 investiu 280.000 euros na organizaci√≥n de 12 encontros
A cita naronesa combina a exhibici√≥n dunha ducia de espect√°culos cun programa paralelo no que destaca a rolda de negocios para promover a contrataci√≥n internacional de compa√±√≠as galegas
Nar√≥n (A Coru√±a), 21 de febreiro de 2024
O director da Axencia Galega das Industrias Culturais da Xunta, Jacobo Sutil, participou hoxe na presentaci√≥n en Nar√≥n da 10¬™ edici√≥n de Singular Festival Internacional do Mon√≥logo Teatral, que do 7 ao 30 marzo combinar√° a exhibici√≥n dunha ducia de espect√°culos no Pazo da Cultura co desenvolvemento dunha programaci√≥n profesional de talleres, mesas redondas e unha rolda de negocios para promover a contrataci√≥n internacional de compa√±√≠as galegas.
O representante da Conseller√≠a de Cultura, Lingua e Xuventude destacou precisamente o papel deste evento na profesionalizaci√≥n e na visibilidade do mon√≥logo como formato teatral cun gran potencial de proxecci√≥n internacional, no que Galicia conta cunha destacada representaci√≥n art√≠stica e cunha ampla tradici√≥n baseada na cultura da narraci√≥n oral.
As√≠ mesmo, lembrou que a cita naronesa foi unha das 12 subvencionadas en 2024 a trav√©s da li√±a anual de axudas da Xunta de Galicia para festivais de artes esc√©nicas, dotada con 280.000 euros, ao tempo que anunciou que a convocatoria correspondente a 2025 ser√° publicada nas vindeiras semanas.
Carteleira internacional
A representaci√≥n galega na carteleira do 10¬∫ Singular corre a cargo de Diego Anido, Ch√©vere, Atenea Garc√≠a e, no apartado da programaci√≥n para p√∫blico infantil, Manuela Varela, Elefante Elegante, Cris de Caldas e A Xanela do Max√≠n. As s√∫as propostas conviven coas de co√±ecidos nomes do panorama estatal, como Toni Acosta, Alberto San Juan e Teatro del Barrio, ademais de coa compa√±√≠a cubana Aire Fr√≠o e a arxentina Rey Marciali Producciones.
Ademais, o festival v√©n incorporando nas s√∫as √∫ltimas edici√≥ns unha serie de actividades paralelas pensadas para os profesionais do sector, que este ano se concretan nun taller actoral a cargo da cubana Beatriz Vi√±as, un seminario de clown que impartir√° a arxentina Julieta Daga, unha mesa redonda sobre programaci√≥n en Galicia de espect√°culos internacionais e unha rolda de negocios para facilitar o encontro de compa√±√≠as galegas con profesionais da programaci√≥n cultural procedentes de diferentes pa√≠ses, como Arxentina, Colombia, Costa Rica, Estados Unidos, Rep√∫blica Dominicana ou Uruguai, as√≠ como doutros puntos de Espa√±a.
A ra√≠z desta √∫ltima iniciativa, o ano pasado catro formaci√≥ns de Galicia concretaron xiras por Uruguai, Costa Rica e Nicaragua, para as que tam√©n tiveron √° s√∫a disposici√≥n as axudas √° distribuci√≥n nas industrias culturais, convocadas anualmente pola Axencia Galega das Industrias Culturais co obxectivo de favorecer a internacionalizaci√≥n das nosas artes esc√©nicas e musicais.

author: AFP
title: Papa Francisco continua em estado 'cr√≠tico', anuncia Vaticano | GZH
text:
O papa Francisco, que est√° internado devido a uma pneumonia, continua em estado "cr√≠tico" e segue recebendo oxig√™nio, mas n√£o apresentou novas crises respirat√≥rias desde a noite de s√°bado, informou o Vaticano neste domingo (23).
"A complexidade do quadro cl√≠nico e a espera necess√°ria para que as terapias farmacol√≥gicas fa√ßam efeito exigem manter o progn√≥stico reservado", de acordo com o √∫ltimo boletim de sa√∫de divulgado.
O jesu√≠ta argentino, de 88 anos, precisou passar por transfus√µes de sangue para que o n√≠vel de hemoglobina subisse, enquanto seu quadro de trombocitopenia (queda no n√∫mero de plaquetas) permaneceu est√°vel, informaram os m√©dicos do hospital Gemelli de Roma.
"No entanto, alguns exames de sangue mostram uma insufici√™ncia renal inicial, leve, atualmente sob controle", acrescentaram.
"A oxigenoterapia de alto fluxo continua por via nasal", disseram, esclarecendo que o papa est√° consciente.
"Pela manh√£, no apartamento adaptado no 10¬∫ andar, ele participou da Santa Missa, com as pessoas que est√£o cuidando dele durante esses dias de hospitaliza√ß√£o", explicou a mesma fonte.
* AFP

author: RLT
title: El tiempo en Le√≥n en Semana Santa: Aemet pronostica unas vacaciones revueltas
text: Secciones Servicios Destacamos RLT Valencia Viernes, 22 de marzo 2024, 19:38 Necesitas ser suscriptor para acceder a esta funcionalidad. Compartir La previsi√≥n del tiempo en Semana Santa en Le√≥n es una de las mayores preocupaciones para todos los que planifican sus vacaciones y viajes en estas fechas o simplemente buscan descansar en esta localidad. ¬øHabr√° lluvia o saldr√° el sol? ¬øCambiar√° el tiempo estos d√≠as? Aemet ha pronosticado una Semana Santa pasada por agua en casi toda Espa√±a por la llegada de una DANA que barrer√° la pen√≠nsula de oeste a este, aunque dejar√° zonas con sol en especial en el litoral mediterr√°neo. Si vas a pasar la Semana Santa o la Pascua en Le√≥n o en localidades cercanas, puedes consultar la previsi√≥n del tiempo oficial de Aemet para la Semana Santa 2024 en tiempo real y el pron√≥stico para los d√≠as siguientes. La predicci√≥n de los mapas se actualiza autom√°ticamente con el paso de los d√≠as, por lo que podr√°s consultar la previsi√≥n oficial del tiempo de Aemet durante toda la Semana Santa y los d√≠as posteriores. El pron√≥stico del tiempo para la ciudad de Le√≥n muestra una variaci√≥n en las condiciones clim√°ticas en los pr√≥ximos d√≠as. La temperatura oscilar√° entre los 8¬∫ y los 25¬∫ grados, presentando un cielo despejado durante el d√≠a del 22 de marzo, con una humedad que oscila entre el 35% y el 75%. Para la noche del mismo d√≠a, se espera un ligero descenso en la temperatura, con m√≠nimas de 21¬∫ y m√°ximas de 25¬∫. El cielo estar√° poco nuboso y la humedad se mantendr√° entre el 35% y el 75%. El d√≠a 23 de marzo, las condiciones clim√°ticas cambiar√°n ligeramente. Durante la madrugada, se esperan nubes altas con temperaturas que oscilar√°n entre los 5¬∫ y los 19¬∫ grados. La humedad aumentar√°, alcanzando un m√°ximo del 90%. A lo largo del d√≠a, el cielo estar√° poco nuboso con temperaturas que oscilan entre los 5¬∫ y los 19¬∫ grados. La humedad disminuir√° ligeramente, quedando entre el 35% y el 90%. Para el 24 de marzo, se espera un cielo poco nuboso durante todo el d√≠a con temperaturas que oscilan entre los 0¬∫ y los 19¬∫ grados. La humedad podr√≠a llegar hasta el 100%. El 25 de marzo, el cielo estar√° nuboso con posibilidad de lluvia. Las temperaturas oscilar√°n entre los 2¬∫ y los 16¬∫ grados y la humedad estar√° entre el 45% y el 80%. Para los d√≠as 26 y 27 de marzo, se espera nieve y lluvia respectivamente. Las temperaturas oscilar√°n entre los 0¬∫ y los 14¬∫ grados y la humedad estar√° entre el 50% y el 100%. Finalmente, para el d√≠a 28 de marzo, se espera un cielo cubierto con lluvia con temperaturas que oscilan entre los 7¬∫ y los 15¬∫ grados y una humedad entre el 70% y el 100%.
